intro: Coleosanthus glutinosus, commonly known as the sticky leek, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that exude a sticky substance. The plant typically grows in wet, sandy soils near coastal areas. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or white. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying tropical flora.
